DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether manipulative osteopathic treatment associate exercise improves pain function individual chronic non-specific neck pain
DOC.brief_title: The Effect Osteopathic Treatment Pain Functionality Individuals With Chronic Neck Pain
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study determine whether manipulative osteopathic treatment associate exercise improves pain function individual chronic non-specific neck pain Design : randomize single blind placebo control trial conduct trial . Patients ( n=40 ) non-specific neck pain randomize receive 1 ) osteopathic manipulative treatment exercise ( n=20 ) 2 ) exercise alone ( n=20 ) . Participants receive 8 treatment 4 week . Clinical outcome obtain 1 week , four week 24 week end treatment . Methods : The primary outcome pain measure 11-point numerical pain rating scale . The secondary outcome disability measure Neck Disability Index , range motion measure Cervical Range Motion device , Pressure pain threshold measure electronic algometer .
DOC.criteria: Symptoms chronic neck pain specify persist 3 month individual report inflammatory previous surgery , spondylolisthesis , spinal stenosis , herniated disc , radiculopathy , fracture musculoskeletal degenerative disease . , Cancer , neurological disease , pregnancy . They exclude participant receive form manipulative treatment last three month .
